subject: Re: [junit] automatic test suite creation
msgSnippet: ... It was an article in JavaWorld, JUnit Best Practices and it had source attached to it for bp.TestAll which recurses through a class structure on disk and
messageBody:
On Mon, 26 Mar 2001, Emily Catharine Bache wrote:

>
> Hi everyone,
>
> I'm having trouble remembering to update my AllTests.suite() method every
> time I create a new TestCase subclass. (I use this class to run all the unit
> tests in my project). This is rather annoying, and I read somewhere that
> there is a tool for automatically creating test suites, rather than
> maintaining a class like this by hand. As I remember, it was a case of
> pointing this tool at your classpath and it would go away and find all your
> test classes and create a suite for them. Does such a tool exist? Can anyone
> tell me where I can get it? I had a look around junit.org but I couldn't see
> anything like it.

It was an article in JavaWorld, "JUnit Best Practices" and it had source
attached to it for bp.TestAll which recurses through a class structure on
disk and runs every test class it encounters. There was a thread here
a few weeks ago, I think, where I helped someone get it running. It's
quite particular about the classpath.

However, it appears JavaWorld's website has moved the article, the link I
have for it is broken today. :(

I have the original source zip, if you can't find it on JavaWorld's website,
email me privately and I'll send it to you. I don't have the original
article in electronic format, though.

For what it's worth, I don't have the update problem any longer since I
started using the uTest OpenTool with JBuilder. Whenver I create a new
application class and hit 'Syncronize' it creates the test class stub
and updates the AllTests.java file automatically. It's sweet.
